intro: Tetrameles rufinervis, commonly known as the red-veined tetrameles, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody structure and palm-like appearance, with large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive, elongated capsules as fruits. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
